Section: Booking Engine › Quick Summary
Source: booking-engine.md

Modernized a white-label venue booking platform used by hotel chains across Europe. Improved the customer journey, refreshed the frontend, and supported backend features to make the platform faster, more usable, and easier to maintain.

Section: Booking Engine › Card Description
Source: booking-engine.md

A seamless venue booking flow, modernized for hotel chains across Europe.

Section: Booking Engine › Scope
Source: booking-engine.md

Improved the customer-facing booking flow for a white-label platform used by hotels and venues. Focused on usability, modernizing legacy code, and building an embeddable widget for direct bookings on supplier websites.

Section: Booking Engine › What I Did
Source: booking-engine.md

Built and maintained booking pages in Vue, from landing to checkout
Created a lightweight widget for suppliers to embed on their own websites
Improved booking flow and UI using Vuex, Bootstrap, and custom CSS
Supported theming and branding needs across multiple white-label clients
Contributed to backend features and integrations supporting the booking process

Section: Booking Engine › Impact
Source: booking-engine.md

Improved the full customer journey—from landing page to booking confirmation
Helped modernize the codebase while staying compatible with older systems
Enabled easier customization for suppliers through flexible theming and branch support
Platform was recognized for innovation on 
HotelTechReport
Trusted by leading hotel groups like 
Scandic Hotels
 and 
Nordic Choice Hotels
 through white-label solutions

Section: Booking Engine › Collaboration
Source: booking-engine.md

Partnered with backend developers to integrate features and fix issues quickly
Shared knowledge with junior teammates through code reviews and pairing

Section: Bumi Cafe › Duration
Source: bumi-cafe.md

June 2020 - June 2020

Section: Bumi Cafe › Stacks
Source: bumi-cafe.md

WordPress, HTML, CSS, JavaScript

Section: Bumi Cafe › Card Description
Source: bumi-cafe.md

Helped Bumi launch fast by shipping critical pages and fixing core issues

Section: Bumi Cafe › Quick Summary
Source: bumi-cafe.md

Stepped in as a freelancer to help Bumi launch on time after delays with the original team. Delivered two new pages, fixed styling issues across the site, and shipped admin features that improved internal workflows.

Section: Bumi Cafe › Scope
Source: bumi-cafe.md

Bumi brought in extra support to get their site launch-ready after delays with an earlier team. The goal: finish key public and admin features quickly without compromising quality. The project needed someone who could jump in fast, work independently, and keep things moving.

Section: Bumi Cafe › What I Did
Source: bumi-cafe.md

Built the About and Catering pages from the ground up
Fixed layout and styling issues across existing public-facing pages
Added new admin features to streamline content management

Section: Bumi Cafe › Impact
Source: bumi-cafe.md

Delivered critical features in time for launch
Boosted site consistency and user experience
Improved internal workflows through clearer, easier admin tools

Section: Bumi Cafe › Collaboration
Source: bumi-cafe.md

Worked directly with the Bumi team to align on goals and unblock progress
Communicated regularly to stay synced while navigating an existing codebase and shifting priorities

Section: Summary
Source: cv.md

Full-stack developer with 5+ years of experience in the hospitality and energy sectors. Designed and built 2× award-winning booking systems used by leading Nordic venues and a global pricing platform adopted in 10+ markets. Led UI modernization, improved accessibility and performance, and integrated systems like Stripe and Oracle. Adapted to both startup speed and enterprise scale. Certified in Azure and AWS, with hands-on experience delivering cloud-native, scalable solutions.

Section: Selected Experience › Nordcloud | Senior Developer
Source: cv.md

Apr 2022 – Present

Section: Selected Experience › Nordcloud | Senior Developer › Global Pricing Platform
Source: cv.md

Redesigned core navigation and pricing workflows using React, TypeScript, Material UI, and Redux Toolkit, streamlining regional user flows and improving UI consistency and accessibility
Optimized large-scale data rendering and responsiveness for pricing tables with thousands of rows using react-window, and reduced redundant API calls by up to 50% via react-query caching
Maintained 100% test coverage for new features with Jest and CI thresholds, boosting overall coverage by 10%
Integrated backend-generated types and implemented feature flags to enable safe, region-specific rollouts

Section: Selected Experience › Nordcloud | Senior Developer › DevOps Foundation
Source: cv.md

Led frontend development with React, TypeScript, and Material UI for an internal tool automating Azure DevOps project setup, standardizing workflows and reducing manual setup time from hours to minutes
Built multi-tenant authentication with MSAL and Azure AD, enabling secure external team deployment via SSO
Maintained 100% test coverage with Playwright and Jest, with clear documentation to support adoption across teams

Section: Selected Experience › MeetingPackage | Full-stack Developer
Source: cv.md

Sep 2019 – Apr 2022

Section: Selected Experience › MeetingPackage | Full-stack Developer › Booking Engine
Source: cv.md

Modernized a white-label venue booking platform using Vue, Vuex, and Bootstrap, improving end-to-end booking flow for hotel groups like Scandic and Nordic Choice, as well as independent venues
Built a themable embeddable booking widget, enabling suppliers to deploy branded booking tools on their own sites
Mentored two junior developers through knowledge-sharing sessions and regular pair programming

Section: Selected Experience › MeetingPackage | Full-stack Developer › Venue Sale Management
Source: cv.md

Modernized key dashboards using React, Redux, and Material UI, migrating legacy jQuery/PHP codebases without disrupting workflows
Integrated Oracle and Mews systems to streamline hotel operations, contributing to an award-winning hotel platform

Section: Side Projects & Hackathons
Source: cv.md

Data 4 Healthy Recovery 2021: Built a cell-culture simulation dashboard that won 1st place in an EU accelerator hackathon
Bumi Cafe 2020: Developed two public pages and admin features in WordPress to support an on-time launch

Section: Technical Skills
Source: cv.md

Frontend: TypeScript, React, Next.js, Vue.js, CSS3, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui, Material UI
Backend: Node.js, Express, Prisma, Drizzle ORM, Zod, MongoDB, MySQL, PostgreSQL
Cloud & DevOps: Azure, AWS, Serverless, Docker, GitHub Actions
Testing & Others: Jest, Cypress, Playwright, Stripe API, Figma, Supabase
Languages: English (Full Professional), Vietnamese (Native), Finnish (Basic)

Section: Data 4 Healthy Recovery › Duration
Source: data-4-health-recovery.md

June 2021 - Sep 2021

Section: Data 4 Healthy Recovery › Stacks
Source: data-4-health-recovery.md

React, MUI, Context, Algorithm, React-ApexCharts

Section: Data 4 Healthy Recovery › Card Description
Source: data-4-health-recovery.md

Award-winning interactive simulation dashboard built for scientists.

Section: Data 4 Healthy Recovery › Quick Summary
Source: data-4-health-recovery.md

Built an interactive, mobile-friendly dashboard that lets scientists simulate cell cultures digitally. Our solution won first place at the EU's Data 4 Healthy Recovery Accelerator.

Section: Data 4 Healthy Recovery › Scope
Source: data-4-health-recovery.md

Built a web-based tool to help scientists simulate cell cultures digitally. The goal was to support research and education by making simulation accessible without lab equipment — all from a browser, on any device.

Section: Data 4 Healthy Recovery › What I Did
Source: data-4-health-recovery.md

Designed and built an interactive dashboard for configuring and running simulations
Optimized layout and responsiveness for both desktop and mobile users
Mapped scientific workflows into a clear, intuitive interface for non-technical users
Implemented real-time input handling and dynamic visual feedback

Section: Data 4 Healthy Recovery › Impact
Source: data-4-health-recovery.md

Awarded first place in the EU's Data 4 Healthy Recovery Accelerator
Enabled scientists and educators to simulate experiments outside the lab
Made complex cell modeling more approachable and accessible

React, MSAL, Azure, TypeScript, React-Query, MUI, Jest, Playwright, MongoDB, CI/CD

An internal application focused on secure Azure integration and testing automation.

Section: DevOps Foundation › Quick Summary
Source: devops-foundation.md

Led frontend development for a secure internal tool that automates Azure DevOps project setup. Focused on authentication, test coverage, CI/CD, and close collaboration with backend developers.

Section: DevOps Foundation › Scope
Source: devops-foundation.md

Built an internal tool that automates the setup of Azure DevOps projects. It helps teams onboard faster with consistent configurations, built-in security practices, and better visibility into project costs.

Section: DevOps Foundation › What I Did
Source: devops-foundation.md

Led the frontend architecture and helped shape the overall user experience
Took the frontend from first lines of code to production-ready release
Built a secure login flow using Microsoft Authentication Library (MSAL)
Wrote end-to-end tests with Playwright to catch issues early
Kept full test coverage across the frontend codebase
Contributed to the CI/CD setup to make deployments smoother
Paired regularly with backend developers for tight integration and faster feedback

Section: DevOps Foundation › Impact
Source: devops-foundation.md

Improved reliability and developer confidence through full test coverage and automation
Enhanced user authentication and security through proper identity integration
Reduced time and effort spent on manual project setup

Section: DevOps Foundation › Collaboration
Source: devops-foundation.md

Worked closely with backend engineers and stakeholders from design through delivery
Led technical decisions for the frontend and helped keep things aligned across the team
Shared knowledge through pair programming, code reviews, and everyday problem-solving

Section: Tell me about yourself
Source: faq.md

I'm a Senior Full-stack Developer with over 5 years of experience, specializing in TypeScript, React, and Node.js. I’ve contributed to both legacy systems and greenfield builds, always focused on performance, maintainability, and code quality.

Section: Tell me about yourself
Source: faq.md

At MeetingPackage, I led the migration from jQuery to React, building a white-label venue management dashboard to help suppliers track bookings, sources, and inventory. On the backend, I handled data modeling, caching strategies, middleware, and integrations with services like Stripe and Oracle.

Section: Tell me about yourself
Source: faq.md

At Nordcloud, I worked on a global pricing platform for a leading UK energy provider. I rebuilt the pricing page, improved navigation usability, and reduced re-renders and API calls. I also introduced backend-generated types to improve maintainability, supported junior developers, contributed to code reviews, and ensured full test coverage.

Section: Tell me about the teams you've worked on
Source: faq.md

I've worked in both small startup teams and larger enterprise setups.

headings: Tell me about the teams you've worked on

pageContent:
Section: Tell me about the teams you've worked on
Source: faq.md

At MeetingPackage (startup), the dev team was under 10 people. I had ownership across the stack, especially on the frontend. We worked closely, from brainstorming to deployment. I migrated legacy jQuery dashboards to React and built white-label solutions. Pair programming and fast feedback loops were common.

headings: Tell me about the teams you've worked on

pageContent:
Section: Tell me about the teams you've worked on
Source: faq.md

At Nordcloud (enterprise), I was part of one of 8 cross-functional teams, each with ~10 members. My team owned the frontend, collaborating with backend developers. We followed Agile practices like daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospectives. I contributed via mentorship, code reviews, and architecture discussions across teams.

headings: Tell me about the teams you've worked on

pageContent:
Section: Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a coworker
Source: faq.md

On a previous project, our design team frequently introduced custom UI elements for each feature, straying from our existing component library. This caused inconsistencies and slowed down development.

headings: Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a coworker

pageContent:
Section: Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a coworker
Source: faq.md

I reached out to the design lead to discuss the challenges. Together we reviewed the designs and agreed to extend our shared component system to support the new needs without breaking consistency. This collaboration improved both developer speed and user experience.

headings: Tell me about a time you had a conflict with a coworker

pageContent:
Section: Tell me about a time you mentored a junior developer
Source: faq.md

While onboarding juniors, I assess their strengths, provide regular check-ins, and use pair programming and code reviews to build confidence. I also encourage them to contribute to documentation and keep our onboarding materials current.

headings: Tell me about a time you mentored a junior developer

pageContent:
Section: Tell me about a time you mentored a junior developer
Source: faq.md

One junior developer went from asking frequent questions to independently owning a small feature within their first two months, thanks to consistent feedback and support.

headings: Tell me about a time you mentored a junior developer

pageContent:
Section: What’s a technical decision you made that had a big impact?
Source: faq.md

On the pricing platform at Nordcloud, we switched to backend-generated TypeScript types, improving type safety and reducing API-related bugs. We also introduced React Query, which dramatically reduced redundant API calls and improved perceived performance.

headings: What’s a technical decision you made that had a big impact?

pageContent:
Section: How do you approach legacy code?
Source: faq.md

During the jQuery-to-React migration at MeetingPackage, I adopted a gradual modernization approach. We maintained legacy UI in parallel, isolated jQuery code, and slowly rebuilt components in React. This avoided regressions and enabled feature development in the new system while keeping the old one functional.

headings: How do you approach legacy code?

pageContent:
Section: What's your view on testing?
Source: faq.md

Testing isn't just about coverage—it's about confidence and maintainability. I aim for 100% test coverage on critical features, but more importantly, I ensure tests are clear, reliable, and run fast. I write unit tests with Jest, integration tests with Supertest, and E2E tests with Playwright or Cypress.

Section: How do you approach CI/CD?
Source: faq.md

I've worked with Travis CI, GitHub Actions, and Azure DevOps. I configure pipelines to run test suites, perform lint checks, and deploy to staging environments. CI/CD helps enforce quality gates and reduces integration friction.

Section: Can you tell me a bit about yourself and your background?
Source: faq.md

I'm a Senior Full-stack Developer with over 5 years of experience in the hospitality and energy sectors. I specialize in building scalable web applications and cloud-native platforms, with a strong focus on frontend development and UI modernization.

headings: Can you tell me a bit about yourself and your background?

pageContent:
Section: What industries have you worked in, and which ones interest you most?
Source: faq.md

I have worked in the hospitality industry (hotel booking platforms) and energy (cloud pricing platforms). I'm particularly interested in SaaS, cloud infrastructure, and developer tooling sectors.

headings: What industries have you worked in, and which ones interest you most?

pageContent:
Section: What programming languages and frameworks are you most proficient in?
Source: faq.md

I am most proficient in TypeScript, JavaScript, Node.js, React, Vue.js, and server-side technologies like Express and Prisma ORM.

headings: What programming languages and frameworks are you most proficient in?

pageContent:
Section: Do you prefer frontend, backend, or full-stack development?
Source: faq.md

I enjoy full-stack development but have a stronger passion for frontend engineering, especially building scalable, accessible, and beautiful UIs.

headings: Do you prefer frontend, backend, or full-stack development?

pageContent:
Section: What kind of projects have you worked on recently?
Source: faq.md

Recently, I worked on a global cloud pricing platform at Nordcloud and an internal DevOps automation tool for Azure project setup.

headings: What kind of projects have you worked on recently?

pageContent:
Section: What are your career goals for the next few years?
Source: faq.md

I aim to deepen my expertise in scalable frontend architectures and cloud-native solutions, and eventually move into a tech leadership or staff engineer role.

headings: What are your career goals for the next few years?

pageContent:
Section: Which project makes you proud?
Source: faq.md

My portfolio at trungung.com is a full-stack showcase of how I build modern, interactive web experiences. It features TrungBot, an AI assistant powered by Vercel AI SDK, OpenAI tools, and a context-aware RAG pipeline. I use Next.js, Tailwind CSS, TypeScript, and a custom embedding & retrieval system to serve accurate responses based on my resume and past work.

Section: What made your booking system award-winning? What problems did it solve?
Source: faq.md

It streamlined hotel venue booking workflows, improved accessibility, and offered a customizable white-label widget for hotels to integrate easily—leading to significant adoption by Nordic hotel groups.

headings: What made your booking system award-winning? What problems did it solve?

pageContent:
Section: What was your role in the global pricing platform used in 10+ markets?
Source: faq.md

I redesigned the core navigation and workflows, optimized data rendering performance, reduced redundant API calls, and ensured accessibility and consistency across regions.

headings: What was your role in the global pricing platform used in 10+ markets?

pageContent:
Section: What did you build for the EU hackathon, and how did it win 1st place?
Source: faq.md

I built a cell culture simulation dashboard, focusing on usability, interactivity, and clear data visualizations, which helped us win the Data 4 Healthy Recovery 2021 hackathon.

headings: What did you build for the EU hackathon, and how did it win 1st place?

pageContent:
Section: How did you modernize UI and improve accessibility in your projects?
Source: faq.md

I used component libraries like Material UI, ensured keyboard navigation, proper ARIA attributes, and conducted accessibility audits to improve WCAG compliance.

headings: How did you modernize UI and improve accessibility in your projects?

pageContent:
Section: How did you optimize large React data tables and reduce API calls?
Source: faq.md

By using 
react-window
 for virtualization and 
react-query
 caching strategies, I significantly reduced unnecessary re-renders and API traffic.

headings: How did you optimize large React data tables and reduce API calls?

pageContent:
Section: What’s your current tech stack and why do you use it?
Source: faq.md

TypeScript + React (or Next.js) for frontend, Node.js + Prisma/PostgreSQL for backend, and Azure + AWS for cloud services—offering strong typing, scalability, and excellent cloud integration.

headings: What’s your current tech stack and why do you use it?

pageContent:
Section: Can you describe a project using React, TypeScript, and Material UI?
Source: faq.md

The global pricing platform at Nordcloud, where I built workflows, improved navigation UX, and implemented scalable UI components.

headings: Can you describe a project using React, TypeScript, and Material UI?

pageContent:
Section: How do you manage state complexity in Redux Toolkit or Vuex?
Source: faq.md

I use slices and normalized state structures in Redux Toolkit, and modular stores in Vuex, to maintain scalability and ease of debugging.

headings: How do you manage state complexity in Redux Toolkit or Vuex?

pageContent:
Section: Have you used Zod for backend validation? In what context?
Source: faq.md

Yes—schema validation of API request bodies and responses in Node.js backends, ensuring early error catching and strong typing.

headings: Have you used Zod for backend validation? In what context?

pageContent:
Section: How do you apply your cloud certifications (Azure, AWS) in real projects?
Source: faq.md

I applied Azure skills to build SSO authentication flows and automate Azure DevOps setup; AWS knowledge helped architect cloud-native serverless solutions.

headings: How do you apply your cloud certifications (Azure, AWS) in real projects?

pageContent:
Section: What’s your philosophy on building accessible and user-friendly UIs?
Source: faq.md

Accessibility must be baked in from the start, not treated as an afterthought. I emphasize semantic HTML, ARIA roles, keyboard interactions, and responsive design.

headings: What’s your philosophy on building accessible and user-friendly UIs?

pageContent:
Section: How do you approach performance optimization in the frontend?
Source: faq.md

Virtualization for large data (react-window), memoization (React.memo/useMemo), lazy loading components, and minimizing critical render paths.

headings: How do you approach performance optimization in the frontend?

pageContent:
Section: How do you choose or build component libraries?
Source: faq.md

I prefer robust libraries like Material UI or shadcn/ui for scalability, but build lightweight custom component systems for highly customized apps.

headings: How do you choose or build component libraries?

pageContent:
Section: Can you explain how you implemented feature flags for region-specific rollouts?
Source: faq.md

I integrated feature flags controlled from backend configurations to selectively enable features per region safely without full redeployments.

headings: Can you explain how you implemented feature flags for region-specific rollouts?

pageContent:
Section: What practices do you follow when designing REST APIs?
Source: faq.md

Clear resource-based URL design, proper use of HTTP methods/status codes, input validation (Zod), and consistent error handling.

headings: What practices do you follow when designing REST APIs?

pageContent:
Section: How do you handle multi-region or multi-tenant backend architectures?
Source: faq.md

By leveraging tenant-aware services, regionalized endpoints, and careful data segregation policies.

headings: How do you handle multi-region or multi-tenant backend architectures?

pageContent:
Section: How do you securely integrate third-party systems like Stripe, Oracle, or Mews?
Source: faq.md

Secure API gateways, OAuth flows when available, validating all incoming/outgoing data, and monitoring API usage.

headings: How do you securely integrate third-party systems like Stripe, Oracle, or Mews?

pageContent:
Section: How did you automate Azure DevOps project setup at Nordcloud?
Source: faq.md

I built a React-based tool interfacing with Azure DevOps APIs to automatically configure projects, pipelines, and permissions, reducing setup from hours to minutes.

headings: How did you automate Azure DevOps project setup at Nordcloud?

pageContent:
Section: What trade-offs have you encountered with serverless vs containers?
Source: faq.md

Serverless scales automatically and is cost-effective for sporadic loads, but containers offer more control and suit long-running services.

headings: What trade-offs have you encountered with serverless vs containers?

pageContent:
Section: How do you ensure security and compliance in cloud-native apps?
Source: faq.md

I use least-privilege IAM, TLS encryption, monitoring/alerting, and follow cloud provider best practices.

headings: How do you ensure security and compliance in cloud-native apps?

pageContent:
Section: Why is 100% test coverage important to you, and how do you achieve it?
Source: faq.md

It builds confidence in code stability. I combine unit, integration, and E2E tests using Jest, Cypress, and Playwright with coverage reporting in CI pipelines.

headings: Why is 100% test coverage important to you, and how do you achieve it?

pageContent:
Section: How do you balance unit, integration, and end-to-end testing?
Source: faq.md

Focus heavily on unit tests, cover critical paths with integration tests, and validate key user journeys with lightweight E2E tests.

headings: How do you balance unit, integration, and end-to-end testing?

pageContent:
Section: Can you share a time when automated tests prevented a critical issue?
Source: faq.md

In Nordcloud’s pricing platform, a Playwright test caught a regression in regional pricing workflows before production.

headings: Can you share a time when automated tests prevented a critical issue?

pageContent:
Section: How do you mentor junior developers or onboard new team members?
Source: faq.md

Through pair programming sessions, code reviews, sharing best practices, and structured onboarding guides.

headings: How do you mentor junior developers or onboard new team members?

pageContent:
Section: How do you work with designers and product owners to shape features?
Source: faq.md

I engage early in the design process, providing technical feedback and ensuring feasibility and scalability.

headings: How do you work with designers and product owners to shape features?

pageContent:
Section: Have you ever challenged a feature or timeline decision? How did you approach it?
Source: faq.md

By presenting data-driven risks and offering alternative solutions, ensuring the team’s goals remain prioritized.

headings: Have you ever challenged a feature or timeline decision? How did you approach it?

pageContent:
Section: What was your role in cross-functional or client-facing teams?
Source: faq.md

Acting as a technical liaison, clarifying requirements, proposing architectures, and ensuring smooth communication between business and tech.

headings: What was your role in cross-functional or client-facing teams?

pageContent:
Section: What developer tools or platforms boost your productivity the most?
Source: faq.md

VSCode, GitHub Actions, Figma, Postman, and Playwright for E2E automation.

headings: What developer tools or platforms boost your productivity the most?

pageContent:
Section: What CI/CD practices have you implemented?
Source: faq.md

PR-based deployments with GitHub Actions, automated lint/test pipelines, and preview environments for frontend branches.

headings: What CI/CD practices have you implemented?

pageContent:
Section: How do you stay up to date with frontend/backend/cloud technologies?
Source: faq.md

I follow ByteByteGo for system design, stay current through Theo T3, daily.dev, and Dev.to, and take courses on Udemy and Skillshare. I also learn by building side projects, exploring tools with AI assistance, and joining hackathons.

headings: How do you stay up to date with frontend/backend/cloud technologies?

pageContent:
Section: What’s a recent tool or library you adopted that had a big impact?
Source: faq.md

I recently adopted shadcn/ui for flexible, accessible component development with Next.js.

headings: What’s a recent tool or library you adopted that had a big impact?

pageContent:
Section: Are you open to learning new tech stacks or switching domains?
Source: faq.md

Absolutely! I enjoy exploring new technologies and adapting to different problem spaces.

headings: Are you open to learning new tech stacks or switching domains?

pageContent:
Section: Do you prefer startups, scale-ups, or large enterprises?
Source: faq.md

I adapt well to all but enjoy the speed and innovation culture of startups and scale-ups most.

headings: Do you prefer startups, scale-ups, or large enterprises?

pageContent:
Section: Are you looking for remote, hybrid, or in-office roles?
Source: faq.md

I am open to remote or hybrid roles with occasional on-site collaboration.

headings: Are you looking for remote, hybrid, or in-office roles?

pageContent:
Section: What kind of team environment do you thrive in?
Source: faq.md

Open, collaborative, and feedback-driven teams where innovation is encouraged.

headings: What kind of team environment do you thrive in?

pageContent:
Section: How do you handle tight deadlines or pressure?
Source: faq.md

I prioritize tasks, communicate early, and focus on delivering high-impact outcomes first.

headings: How do you handle tight deadlines or pressure?

pageContent:
Section: What do you value most in a company culture?
Source: faq.md

Transparency, mutual respect, continuous learning, and a focus on building great products.

headings: What do you value most in a company culture?

pageContent:
Section: How do you approach designing a scalable system?
Source: faq.md

I start with clear requirements, then design modular components that can scale independently—using AWS EC2 Auto Scaling or Azure App Services, with Kubernetes (EKS/AKS) if portability is needed.

headings: How do you approach designing a scalable system?

pageContent:
Section: How do you ensure high availability?
Source: faq.md

I deploy across multiple availability zones or regions using AWS ALB or Azure Load Balancer, and fall back to open-source clustering if required.

headings: How do you ensure high availability?

pageContent:
Section: Can you describe a system you’ve designed?
Source: faq.md

Yes—I designed [insert project], hosted on AWS/Azure, with managed compute, database, and storage. I prioritized scalability, fault tolerance, and portability.

headings: Can you describe a system you’ve designed?

pageContent:
Section: How do you handle data consistency?
Source: faq.md

I use cloud-native consistency settings (DynamoDB/Cosmos DB) or PostgreSQL with replication and locking for stricter control.

headings: How do you handle data consistency?

pageContent:
Section: Monolith vs Microservices — what’s your view?
Source: faq.md

Start with a modular monolith for speed, then break into microservices when scaling demands. Use managed API gateways or open-source alternatives.

headings: Monolith vs Microservices — what’s your view?

pageContent:
Section: How do you handle monitoring and logging?
Source: faq.md

I use AWS CloudWatch/Azure Monitor, or Prometheus/Loki or ELK/EFF stacks for advanced, multi-cloud visibility.

headings: How do you handle monitoring and logging?

pageContent:
Section: What do you consider when designing APIs?
Source: faq.md

RESTful, versioned, secure endpoints. Use API Gateway or Kong/Express middleware for vendor-neutral setups.

headings: What do you consider when designing APIs?

pageContent:
Section: How do you choose between SQL and NoSQL databases?
Source: faq.md

SQL for structured, relational data; NoSQL for flexible schemas at scale—e.g. PostgreSQL vs MongoDB, DynamoDB/Cosmos DB for scalability.

headings: How do you choose between SQL and NoSQL databases?

pageContent:
Section: What is your approach to handling sudden traffic spikes?
Source: faq.md

Auto-scaling compute + CDNs (CloudFront/Azure CDN), plus caching layers (Varnish/Nginx or Redis) for backend load reduction.

headings: What is your approach to handling sudden traffic spikes?

pageContent:
Section: How do you manage authentication and authorization?
Source: faq.md

Managed identity (Azure AD B2C/Cognito) or OAuth2/Keycloak/Auth0 for flexibility, with secure private endpoints.

headings: How do you manage authentication and authorization?

pageContent:
Section: How do you ensure secure system design?
Source: faq.md

TLS encryption, IAM least-privilege, network security groups, secret management (Vault/OPA) and monitoring/alerting.

headings: How do you ensure secure system design?

pageContent:
Section: How do you handle background tasks or async processing?
Source: faq.md

Azure Functions/AWS Lambda with queues (SQS/Azure Storage Queues).

headings: How do you handle background tasks or async processing?

pageContent:
Section: How do you reduce latency in your applications?
Source: faq.md

Edge caching (CDN), in-memory caches (ElastiCache/Redis), and optimizing critical render paths.

headings: How do you reduce latency in your applications?

pageContent:
Section: What is your approach to API rate limiting?
Source: faq.md

Use API Gateway rate limits or express-rate-limit/Nginx proxies in open-source setups.

headings: What is your approach to API rate limiting?

pageContent:
Section: How do you support multi-region deployments?
Source: faq.md

Global traffic routing via Azure Front Door/AWS Route 53, or geo-DNS and global replication.

headings: How do you support multi-region deployments?

pageContent:
Section: What are key trade-offs you consider in system design?
Source: faq.md

Cost vs performance, consistency vs availability, simplicity vs flexibility—balanced with cloud-native and open-source options.

headings: What are key trade-offs you consider in system design?

Section: Global Pricing Platform › Duration
Source: global-pricing-platform.md

Nov 2022 - Mar 2025

Section: Global Pricing Platform › Stacks
Source: global-pricing-platform.md

React, Azure, TypeScript, Feature Flags, Material-UI, Redux, React-Query, React-Window, Jest, Cypress, CI/CD, Scrum

Section: Global Pricing Platform › NDA
Source: global-pricing-platform.md

Yes

Section: Global Pricing Platform › Card Description
Source: global-pricing-platform.md

A pricing tool for a global energy organization, tailored per region.

Section: Global Pricing Platform › Quick Summary
Source: global-pricing-platform.md

Redesigned critical UI, improved performance and test coverage, mentored developers, and collaborated on cross-team architecture for a global-scale pricing app.

Section: Global Pricing Platform › Scope
Source: global-pricing-platform.md

Contributed as a Software Engineer to a pricing platform for a global energy enterprise. The app supported multiple regions with distinct pricing logic and business requirements.

Section: Global Pricing Platform › What I Did
Source: global-pricing-platform.md

Led the redesign of the navigation system and core pricing pages
Developed modular, reusable components using Material UI
Identified and resolved performance bottlenecks in React, improving responsiveness, especially on large-scale data tables
Modernized legacy codebases and integrated backend-generated TypeScript types
Maintained 100% test coverage for new features
Used feature flags to manage region-specific logic and safely roll out new features

Section: Global Pricing Platform › Impact
Source: global-pricing-platform.md

Improved UI consistency and accessibility across regions
Reduced API requests by up to 50% through optimized data fetching and caching strategies
Increased overall test coverage from ~70% to over 80%
Shortened development cycles with a more maintainable codebase
Helped ensure releases stayed predictable through agile collaboration

Section: Global Pricing Platform › Collaboration
Source: global-pricing-platform.md

Collaborated with 8 cross-functional teams on architectural decisions to support a scalable and maintainable system
Mentored junior developers via pair programming, code reviews, and shared design sessions
Presented completed features in bi-weekly sprint reviews, improving stakeholder engagement and feedback loops

Section: Venue Sale Management › Duration
Source: venue-sale-management.md

Nov 2019 - Apr 2022

Section: Venue Sale Management › Stacks
Source: venue-sale-management.md

React, Redux, Formik, MUI, JavaScript, jQuery, PHP, Drupal, MongoDB, MySQL, Redis, Travis

Section: Venue Sale Management › Card Description
Source: venue-sale-management.md

Award-winning hotel venue platform, rebuilt with smoother UX and modern React.

Section: Venue Sale Management › Quick Summary
Source: venue-sale-management.md

Modernized a B2B hotel tech platform that won awards two years in a row. Redesigned dashboards, improved usability, and supported fullstack development. Integrated with Oracle and Mews to streamline workflows for venue partners.

Section: Venue Sale Management › Scope
Source: venue-sale-management.md

Worked as a fullstack developer on a B2B venue and sales management platform used by both hotels and venue suppliers. The project focused on refreshing the core dashboard by improving usability, modernizing legacy code, and supporting a growing engineering team.

Section: Venue Sale Management › What I Did
Source: venue-sale-management.md

Rebuilt key dashboard pages in React, starting with a new analytics view and later migrating parts of the legacy interface
Set up server-side rendering to integrate React into a PHP and jQuery codebase without breaking existing functionality
Maintained and improved legacy PHP and jQuery code to ensure stability during the transition
Wrote and maintained backend logic with MongoDB and Redis, including data caching and performance improvements
Helped integrate with external property management systems like Oracle and Mews
Helped streamline CI/CD using Travis to support faster and more reliable releases

Section: Venue Sale Management › Impact
Source: venue-sale-management.md

The platform won Top Hotel Management Software awards in both 2021 and 2022
Users praised the updated dashboard for being easier to use and more modern
The React migration helped reduce maintenance overhead and made it easier to onboard new developers
CI/CD improvements sped up the deployment process and reduced downtime risks

Section: Venue Sale Management › Collaboration
Source: venue-sale-management.md

Paired with backend engineers to align data models and integrate features smoothly
Supported junior developers with code reviews and pair programming
Contributed to team planning and
